Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Conjugal \Con"ju*gal\, a. [L. conjugalis, fr. conjux husband, wife, consort, fr. conjungere to unite, join in marriage. See {Conjoin}.] Belonging to marriage; suitable or appropriate to the marriage state or to married persons; matrimonial; connubial. ``Conjugal affection.'' --Milton. [1913 Webster]
conjugal adj : of or relating to marriage or to the relationship between a wife and husband; "connubial bliss"; "conjugal visits" [syn: {connubial}]
